turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A fucking wheelchair?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I didn't put him in a wheelchair. Reynard did. He can get around without one -- it's all in my report.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't have time to read every word in every report, I'm too busy getting killed in court... Meantime my crackerjack investigator can't find the goddam art supplies store where Chuckie-fucking-Roeder works!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- Find him?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie, these things take time. Particularly at this hour...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The Joe Boys in 1980...!

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: A number of them are dead, three are in prison, one's a waiter... Two -- you'll enjoy this -- two are actually members of the Chamber of Commerce.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I haven't thanked you for your work, Kitty. You're doing good work.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I'm a professional, Eddie. Getting paid is all the thanks I require.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I haven't paid you.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Got any booze in the house?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You don't drink "booze".

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie, if I wanted to make love with you again, I'd do it sober.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie this is silly... are we supposed to pretend nothing's happened in the last ten years and --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nothing has. But that's all changing.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie... A guilty client's not the end of the world...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: EXACTLY!

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie... go home. Get some sleep.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't need sleep!

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I need sleep. Some of us are mere mortals.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Screw you too, Kitty.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: My mother find you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: Figures.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Want to tell me what went down here?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: Racist asshole came at me.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Exactly what happened then?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: I killed the motherfucker.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...Okay...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: An Aryan Warrior with black teardrops painted on his face.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: "Painted"?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: But why would a guy would do that? Paint black teardrops on his face?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: I guess he... wanted you to think he was... somebody he wasn't.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: But why?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: Maybe... because someone's afraid.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Afraid of what?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: I don't know. The truth, maybe.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- About what?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: About Chinatown. What went down.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What went down?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: You tell me, man.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No. You tell me, Shu.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: How can I tell you what I don't know!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You can't. So tell me what you do know -- say it!

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: I don't know shit, man! Goddammit --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well I know that you're innocent, Shu -- even if you forgot.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: "No," what?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...I'm dying out there.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: It's okay, Eddie.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Quite a bit you didn't tell me.

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: When I joined up I took an oath of secrecy. I told you what you needed to know.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I didn't need to know that a man I'm defending on a gang-murder rap is a prison soldier who kills over drugs?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: It was self-defense.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jimmy Chin? Was that self-defense too?

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: -- How could I help you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: By trusting me. Shit, man...

turns.speaker: SHU
turns.text: When you leave this place you're going out to dinner or a movie or get laid. Where's our bond? I'm going back to my cell and wait to die. So tell me: Where's our bond?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: For awhile we had this dream we were innocent. That was our bond... but then we woke up. And now I'd like to hear everything.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: 'lo, Cecil.

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: See-cil.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: See-cil. I'm Eddie Dowd, this is Roger Baron. We're lawyers.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh come on, Cecil.

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: Hey, Chinese people have this energy field that vibrates at a particular frequency.

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: I did two tours in 'Nam...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Good. Now we're going to take an affadavit from you, but only concerning the facts of the Chinatown shooting. We honestly don't give a shit about the Kennedy assassination.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Are you willing to testify that the man you saw shoot Jimmy Chin was not the man the cops arrested?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: They g-got the wrong g-guy.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: When the D.A. hears I filed the writ, he'll send someone here, maybe claiming to be a journalist. That person will ask you lots of questions. Just be truthful, Cecil, okay? To all of us?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: I always t-tell the truth.  That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...You told the Desk Sergeant you were certain Mr. Kim wasn't the killer?  You left your telephone number?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: Y-yes, sir.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Did the police make any attempt to phone you, to follow up?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: No, s-sir.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Thank you, Mr. Stipe.

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: I'd l-like to answer the question.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Mr. Rabin has no right to --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Edward T. Dowd.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Don Reynard.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Of course you know Dean Rabin, one of my Assistant D.A.s. Dean generally handles nuisance cases like the... what's the man's name?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Shu Kai Kim.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: You won't remember this, but in '72 I was one of several prosecutors assigned to the Black Panther-Police Shootout.  We had a whole team, and you walked into court by yourself and kicked our collective butt.  So what've you been up to since then?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This and that.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: My staff tells me it's been mostly drug pushers... I said that can't be the same Edward Dowd.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's in the area of narcotics, Mr. Reynard, that the government tramples on the Fourth Amendment.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Let's not drag the Constitution into this.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm sorry if I've ruined your day, Mr. Reynard. But my client's had a rough eight years behind bars and --

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Your client is guilty. Don't dick around with me.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Back in the Seventies I spent years putting away gangsters in a Colombian syndicate called "the Ochoa". These guys are very dangerous, Ed. When I hear that a small-time dope lawyer is conniving to spring one of these guys, I see red.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'd have that checked, Mr. Reynard.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Now maybe you got this case reopened because you see yourself as a thorn in society's side, or you want to walk into any restaurant in Chinatown and get free dumplings...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Are you implying that my motives are less than sincere?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Yes, but that's not the issue. What's on your wish list, Ed? Pleading Kim out to first degree man on both homicides, with an agreed sentence of 15 to life running concurrent? Come on... What're you looking for here?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What am I looking for? You're the one talking deal.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Friday's the drop-dead date on the offer.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Please don't bullshit me, Mr. Reynard. You've got witness problems, you've got proof problems...

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: You're my only problem, Ed. What does it take to make you go away?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: I see: He'd walk out next month.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: We reconvict, your man's looking at 25 years on two counts, served consecutively. So what I'd like to ask, Ed, is: Are you joking?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I never joke about waiving a client's Sixth Amendment right to trial.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: You're pissing me off again, Ed.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You know you're very tense, Mr. Reynard. Y'oughta take a week off, fly the wife and kids to Oahu.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: But now you've strayed from your area of expertise -- dope -- into street assassins. A subject on which you're dangerously ignorant.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: But I'm a quick study. Tell your Deputy D.A. -- Rabin? -- that I'll see him in court.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: No, Mr. Dowd, you'll see me in court. I'm prosecuting this case.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: I'll prosecute anyone who fucks up. If that makes me look racist, it's a trade-off I'll live with, Ed.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's big of you, Bob.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Isn't it a fact that the "six other Asian men" in the line-up were all of the classic Mongoloid type, whereas Shu has the distinct facial bone structure of a Korean?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Objection. The witness is not an expert in racial classification.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Isn't it a standard trick to pack a line-up with men who resemble each other but look different than the suspect, so the suspect will stand out for the eyewitnesses?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Argumentative.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Isn't it unusual for a man who's just committed a murder in plain sight to bring the weapon back to his apartment?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Calls for speculation.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You don't speak any Chinese dialects? Then you get your intelligence from snitches?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Badgering.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: To the best of your recollection, were you sober when you performed the tests?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Objection.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Your Honor, that's trial by ambush!

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: We just discovered him, your Honor! His appearance is critical to a fair presentation of our case! He is an inmate at Ossining Correctional and --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- Objection, your Honor! This case has no connection with any subsequent act my client may be charged with!

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: The witness will substantiate Mr. Kim's modus operandi. It's circumstantial evidence in the case at hand!

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: The witness is recalcitrant, your Honor -- I had to personally make a body attachment this morning -- it took two Marshalls to drag him here!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The great personal sacrifices endured by Mr. Reynard have no bearing on the legal issues, your Honor -- !

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Your Honor, I know as much about these gangs as anyone; I'm well aware of the secrecy in which their machinations are cloaked... I assure you this witness offers the court a rare opportunity to place the defendant's crime --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- alleged crime --

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: -- in a context.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: -- Can't Mr. Dowd find his own expert witness, your Honor?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'd need a continuance. Three weeks at least.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Dowd.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Didn't this investigation, with its attendant publicity, catapult you into the office you now hold?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: If I were sitting where I normally sit, I would say "Calls for speculation."

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Did you do any hands-on work or did you just supervise, from on high?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Mr. Dowd, I was personally involved with all phases -- and principals -- of the investigation.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And who were the detectives who assisted you, Mr. Reynard?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Lou Sklaroff, Vin Badalato, Dave Montell.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The same three detectives on the Jimmy Chin case.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: In those days, they often worked as a team.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And who was Arturo Esparza?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: I don't think I know that name.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- But you just said you were personally involved with all the principals of the investigation.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: I can't be expected to remember the name of every informant eight years after the fact.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I didn't say he was an informant. But since you mentioned it, wasn't Esparza your primary informant?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: You're trespassing into the area of witness protection, Mr. Dowd. Such showboating puts lives at risk.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Isn't it true that without Esparza, you had no investigation?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: I think you're a dangerous man, Mr. Dowd.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I hope so, Mr. Reynard.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No? Then what did he say?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You read Eddie's Chase Manhattan Bombing summation in the Leftist Law anthology?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Eddie told you?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: My skip-trace turned up two Cecil Stipes. One's in Butte, Montana. Other's at Riverhead Veterans Psychiatric.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I'll take odds on Cecil Number Two.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: So what'd this guy do? Snitch off a dealer?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You getting this?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Every word.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: But they've still got Laura Gordon -- and she was the closest, about 20 feet from the killer.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: It's okay. It was always like that.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Shouldn't one of us...?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: No -- leave him be. It's better for everyone.

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I'm Roger Baron. I work with Edward Dowd.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: What were you... Why were you at Shu's trial this afternoon?

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: -- What trial?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I followed you here from court.

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: I knew Jimmy Chin. The boy who was shot. Okay?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: ...And you were at the trial to... to see that justice was done?

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Then it was your idea to have Chuckie Roeder scare Eddie off the case?

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: -- Why don't you ask Chuckie?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Chuckie OD'd, Mrs. Esparza. He's dead.

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: Look. Mister --

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Roger --

turns.speaker: MRS. ESPARZA
turns.text: You mustn't talk to Art. You mustn't tell Art that I was at the trial. Do you hear me?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Mr. Ortega, you've known the defendant at Ossining Correctional for how long?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: I would tend to plead the Fifth.

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Five years.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Mr. Ortega... What is "La Compania"?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: A Cubano army, basically... inside and outside prisons.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: And its purpose?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Fighting the Aryan Warriors and the Black Guerrillas, basically.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: For control of the prison drug trade?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: I would tend to plead the Fifth.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Do the rival gangs compete for control of the prison drug trade?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Yeah, we do some of that.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: What is your rank within La Compania?

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: "Name, rank and serial," Mr. Ortega. Let's not hide behind the Fifth.

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: I'm a soldado in the G-Wing Regiment.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: And what does a soldado -- a soldier -- do?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: A soldado, he runs messages and materiel between the regiments...

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: "Materiel"? What do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Cigarettes, candy bars...  PCP, crack...

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: If a member of the Aryan Brothers tries to cut in on your distribution?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: ...A soldado, he takes care of it.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: By "takes care of," you mean "kills".

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Mr. Ortega, what is Shu Kai Kim's rank within La Compania?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Soldado.

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: Isn't it unusual for an Asian to be accepted into a Cuban prison gang?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Shu's the only one I know of...

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: And why was an exception made?

turns.speaker: ORTEGA
turns.text: Chinatown. Sounded pretty cold...

turns.speaker: REYNARD
turns.text: You mean to say Mr. Kim told you that he murdered Jimmy Chin?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: You're a l-lawyer?  I... I haven't had my meds, or m-my vital signs t-taken yet. I...

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Mr. Stipe. A young man named Jimmy Chin was shot to death eight years ago, in Chinatown. Do you remember talking to the police?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: That guy they arrested -- he was the wrong g-guy.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I think what Eddie wants to say is --

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: No! They g-got the wrong guy! I saw it! The killer wasn't Chinese.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: CIA?

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: Telephone.  I suppose you don't know the phone company killed Kennedy because he was trying to b-break it up -- and they'll never let that happen. They control everything: what you say in the mouthpiece is never exactly what comes out the other end, and --

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: The phone company was broken up.

turns.speaker: STIPE
turns.text: And you b-believe that.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Cooper, the ooze of mumbo jumbo is rising up above our heads. Do you honestly think Cole's practice of word association works?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: The very fact that we are talking about word association means we are in a space that was opened up by our practice of word association. The world is a hologram, Albert.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Yes, it's a great big psychedelic circus ride, isn't it, Cooper?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Albert.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: You said, "Teresa Banks", so you think something is going on somewhere in the world right now that is connected with her murder?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Yes. Either right now or right when I thought of it. The name and memory of Teresa Banks is haunting me. Lately I have been filled with a knowingness that the murderer will strike again. Because it is only a feeling, I am powerless to stop it. And another thing, Albert, when the next murder happens you will help me solve it.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Let's test it for the record. Will the next victim be a man or a woman?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: A woman.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: What color hair will she have?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Blonde.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Tell me some other things about her.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: She's in high school. She's sexually active. She's on drugs. She's crying out for some help.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: You're describing half the high school girls in America.  What is she doing right now?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: She is preparing a great abundance of food.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No... No, go away.

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: I'm glad you let me talk to you. You used to not let me talk to you.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Go away. I am not talking to you.

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: I want you.

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: SEE WHAT WE CAN DO TO DONNA?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: NO! GOD, NO...

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: That's not important. I will tell you what is important. The fan will soon be starting.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Who are you? Who are you REALLY?

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: I am the One who wants to breathe thru your nose and taste thru your mouth.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: I want you to kill for me.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: No. Never. You'll have to kill me.

turns.speaker: BOB'S VOICE
turns.text: I want you to kill for me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where were you for the last hour? I've been lookin' for you?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I was right behind you, but you're too dumb to turn around.  If he turned around he might get dizzy and fall down.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'M NOT KIDDIN'. WHERE WERE YOU? WHO WERE YOU WITH?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Get lost Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh, yeah? You'll be callin' soon and maybe I'm not gonna be there.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Oh, come on, sweetie, give me one of your smiles.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm nearly out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's taken care of, babe. You and I are going to make a big score tonight.  This will tide you over.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Thank you, Bobby. A big score?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maybe our biggest. I'll see you two doors down from your place at 11:00.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Don't be late.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Here he comes.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Here he comes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This isn't Mike.  Is this Mike?

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Bobby... ssshhhh... you killed Mike.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Babe, I'm on my way out to the woods to divvy up the product. Put this cash in your safety deposit box...  It's ten thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: You killed Mike.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bad news, kid, it was baby laxative.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What was?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: The stuff we got last night.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Baby laxative? We can't snort baby laxative.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No shit...  We killed a guy for baby laxative.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: What is the world coming to when you kill a guy for baby laxative?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't get funny with me again.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: I'm not... Bobby I'm gonna need some more stuff. I mean it. I'm out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, and I'm gonna need that ten thousand dollars back.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Sure, but I can't get it till after school tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let's ditch this place and party.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Not tonight. Just give me something to take home to hold me over till tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why? Why not? Where are you goin'?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We can do it right here.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Bobby...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bobby's got it.

turns.speaker: LAURA
turns.text: Thanks, Bobby.  And my little round friends, too.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I'm here to investigate the murder of Teresa Banks.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: Well, little fella, we don't need any outside help here. I don't like you people sniffin' around my neck of the woods. In fact, when the state boys called me about a "J. Edgar" coming up I think I said, "So what?"

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Your behavior is not funny and is wasting the time of the Federal Government.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: You're lucky I am not wasting you.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Well, little fella, let me put it this way. The operative word here would be "Federal". With or without the semantics of all this, I am now ordering you to release all pertinent information concerning Teresa Banks, both while living and deceased.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: A basic kill. Banks was a drifter and nobody knew her. My boys have been all over this. It's a dead end.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: That's why we're here, Sheriff Cable. Where's the body?

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: Out back in our morgue.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: It's 4:30. We close at five.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: We've got our own clock. We'll lock up.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: What the hell is that thing doing out there? You're not taking that body anywhere.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: We're taking the body back to Portland and there's not a thing you can do about it.

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: Maybe not a thing, but maybe two things.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Teresa Banks had a ring. Any idea what happened to it?

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: We got a phone, here, that's got a little ring.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Sam, get the body and put it in the van.  Sheriff Cable, where were you the night Teresa Banks was murdered?

turns.speaker: CABLE
turns.text: My alibi is as strong as these bands of steel.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: GOD. I'm beginning to lose faith in the United States Government and that includes the telephone system. Don't you folks talk to one another. That's her trailer there and I haven't touched a god damn thing. Agent Chet Desmond come by a second time and asked too see Deputy Cliff Howard's trailer  ...which I showed him. I went back to my trailer...  After that I never saw him again.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Thank you, Carl.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's not the way to Cliff's trailer. I told you.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: I am not going to Cliff's trailer.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Well, where are you going?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: I am going over here.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: God damn, you people are confusing.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: What was here, Mr. Rodd?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: A trailer was here. What the hell do you think?

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Can you tell me who's trailer it was... and who stayed in the trailer?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: An old woman and her grandson.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Can you tell me what their names were?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Chalfont. Weird. Chalfont was the name of the folks that rented the space before they did. Two Chalfonts.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Is that Agent Desmond's vehicle?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yep, it sure is.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation, Special Agent Chet Desmond and Agent Sam Stanley. Sorry to disturb you, but we would like to see Teresa Banks' trailer, please.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: More popular than Uncle's Day at a whorehouse.  GOD DAMN, THAT MORNING SUN IS BRIGHT! BLUE BRIGHT.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Mrs. Simmons owns the trailer and she lives in town. Teresa rented it about a month ago.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Did she have someone with her?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Right. She had a friend with her. The friend took off.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Was there an argument?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Not that I know of. But arguments do happen, don't they?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Yes they do. Did she have visitors?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: No, hey, I already told this whole damn thing to Sheriff "Not-Quite- Able"... Here's the trailer now.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: You weren't kiddin'. This stuff's got the sting of the forty-eight hour blend.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's right. That's the best coffee you're gonna get around here.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Is there a golf course around here?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Not a lot around here, no. Got some clubs, but not very many fellas with balls.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Thanks for your help, Carl. Sorry we woke you up.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: That's alright. I was having a bad dream. I was dreamin' about a joke with no punchline.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Okay, that's it. I've had enough of the waiting room now.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: What are you doing here in the trailer court, Deputy?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Maybe I just live here, what do you think about that?

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Can I ask you where you were the night Teresa Banks was murdered?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: You can tell J. Edgar that I was at a party and I got fifteen fuckin' witnesses.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Did you know Teresa Banks?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Got a couple of cups of coffee at Hap's from her. That's it. By the way where do you get off questioning a lawman? I could ask you the same question.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: No you couldn't.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: You try that you little monkey.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: I think I'll take off my badge as well.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: CHET, I AM CALLING YOU FROM PORTLAND... OREGON.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: OK, Gordon.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: NO, IT'S OREGON, PORTLAND, OREGON. IT'S REGIONAL BUREAU CHIEF COLE. OUT IN PORTLAND OREGON. I NEED YOU OUT HERE, CHET.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: OK, Gordon.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: OREGON. A YOUNG GIRL HAS BEEN MURDERED. SEVENTEEN YEARS OLD. NAMED TERESA BANKS.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Okay, Gordon!!!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: GOT A MAP OF THE ENVIRONS OF THE YAKIMA INDIAN RESERVATION WITH YOUR NAME ON IT. BETTER BRING A POLE.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Smell something fishy, huh?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'VE GOT A SURPRISE FOR YOU, CHET. SOMETHING INTERESTING THAT I WOULD LIKE TO SHOW YOU. ARRANGEMENTS ARE BEING MADE AND I WILL MEET YOU AT THE PORTLAND, AIRPORT.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Congratulations. I heard about that.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: YOUR SURPRISE, CHET. HER NAME IS LIL.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: GOOD LUCK, CHET.  SAM, YOU STICK WITH CHET, HE'S GOT HIS OWN M.O. MODUS OPERANDI.  YOU CAN REACH ME AT THE PHILADELPHIA OFFICES. I AM FLYING OUT TODAY.

turns.speaker: DESMOND
turns.text: Right, Gordon. We'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: What is it, Gordon?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: COOP, AGENT CHET DESMOND HAS DISAPPEARED. GONE LIKE THE WIND IN DEER MEADOW.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: Phillip?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: COOPER, MEET THE LONG LOST PHILLIP JEFFRIES. YOU MAY HAVE HEARD OF HIM AT THE ACADEMY.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: HE'S GONE.

turns.speaker: COOPER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: ALBERT, COME BACK HERE. HE'S GONE CALL THE FRONT DESK.
